title: What is the longest period of time that the FTSE has been closed? - Quora

response.answer_text: From the LSE website - 1939The start of World War Two. The Exchange is closed for 6 days and reopens on 7 September. The floor of the House closes for only one more day, in 1945 due to damage from a V2 rocket – trading then continues in the basement. It was the FT30 index back then.
